document_data.name: Jolym
document_data.mainbody: '''Jolym''' was a cooper and crate maker at [[Jolym's Barrels & Packing]] in the city of [[Loudwater]] in the [[Delimbiyr Vale]] in the mid-to-late 14{{th}} to late 15{{th}} centuries [[DR]].{{Cite video/Honor Among Thieves}}
document_data.Activities: From his store circa [[1366 DR]], Jolym sold [[barrel]]s, [[hand keg]]s, and standard-sized crates. Jolym also manufactured packing crates of custom size or purpose.
document_data.History: In the 1490s DR,{{HAT-time}} the thieves [[Edgin Darvis]], [[Holga Kilgore]], [[Forge Fitzwilliam]], [[Kira]], and [[Simon Aumar]] pulled a robbery in Loudwater. The [[sorcerer]] Simon tried to cast a ''[[spider climb]]'' [[spell]] but couldn't make it work until Jolym set his [[dog]] on him, and then he had no trouble at all.
